page.title: 16E.Horsley S. Nomad Players
page.content: In 1984 the Nomad Players celebrated their 50th birthday. Originally they had no permanent venue for their pro- ductions, hence the name 'Nomads'. In December 1956, a theatre conversion began on a building in E.Horsley which had previously been a carriage shed & a milking parlour on the Lovelace Est- ate. By April 1957, after dedicated hard work from members the first pro- duction was staged there. Although all amateurs, the Players are renowned for their high standards & profession- al attention to detail. Over the years there have been more than 120 produc- tions, as well as revues & cabarets. Running an amateur theatre is costly, Â£2,000 being needed annually for main- tenance alone. Finance is provided by annual subscriptions, fund-raising events, a Draw Club and a bar for mem- bers. It is now a registered Charity.
